roleset.name: establish the truth

example.name: prove an NP
example.text: ``We-1 look upon this as a great opportunity *trace*-1 to prove the fact that we have a tremendous management team,'' he said.
example.arg: the fact that we have a tremendous management team

example.name: prove an SBAR
example.text: ``Wall Street's cash cow has been gored, but I don't think anyone has proven that index arbitrage is the problem.''
example.arg: that index arbitrage is the problem

example.name: unaccusative, adjectival predicate
example.text: Dealers said institutions were still largely hugging the sidelines on fears that [the market's recent technical rally]-1 might prove *trace*-1 fragile.

example.name: unaccusative, NP predicate
example.text: His client contacts, meanwhile, could prove a gold mine for an agency that has had few new business wins of late.
example.note: In this example, there is no trace for the subject following the verb. Because of this, concatenation is necessary-- but don't concatenate unless you have to!
example.arg: [His client contacts],[a gold mine for an agency that has had few new business wins of late]

example.name: with benefactive
example.text: John proved to Mary that he could kiss his own elbow.
example.arg: that he could kiss his own elbow

roleset.note: VN updated by Julia. Member of Vncls declare-29.4-1-1, deduce-97.2, indicate-78-1-1.

predicate.note: Frames file for 'prove' based on sentences in financial subcorpus.
